intro: Pentacalia tingoensis, commonly known as the Tingoensis pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly glossy appearance. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
